docs.title: README
docs.text:
This project aims to document the Scratch API and other features, such as the sb3 file format. The source of these docs is available on GitHub.

You can make contributions by opening a pull request on GitHub

The docs are licensed under MIT

docs.title: API
docs.text:
API stands for application-programmer-interface. Essentially what this means is a way to integrate your code with scratch.

Scratch itself provides a number of urls which can be used for interaction via web requests, shown below.

Info

It is recommended to use an existing library to interact with scratch instead of making your own

docs.title: Web API
docs.text:
In order to make requests to scratch, there are a multitude of different urls where you can make GET, POST, PUT, DELETE and other types of request.

These urls can be generally categorized by their subdomain and/or path.

Warning

This is not a complete list.

docs.title: Scratch
docs.text: URL Purpose https://scratch.mit.edu/ The main website https://api.scratch.mit.edu/ The main API for public use, documented on the scratch wiki https://assets.scratch.mit.edu/ Interaction with assets (costumes and sounds) https://backpack.scratch.mit.edu/ Interaction with the backpack https://scratch.mit.edu/site-api/ An API used internally by the scratch website. Provides access for the same things, but less restrictive, e.g. classroom alerts wss://clouddata.scratch.mit.edu/ This is where the scratch cloud server websocket lives https://projects.scratch.mit.edu Downloading projects https://uploads.scratch.mit.edu Thumbnails/profile images https://translate-service.scratch.mit.edu/ Translation requests - which the translate extension uses https://cdn.scratch.mit.edu Content delivery network - hosts images, css, js, emojis, etc. https://synthesis-service.scratch.mit.edu Text2Speech requests - which the Text2Speech extension uses

docs.title: ScratchAttach
docs.text: A sync (developing async) python library for the scratch API and other site features.

docs.title: Scapi
docs.text: An async python library for the scratch web API, using aiohttp. Docs in Japanese.

docs.title: ScratchAttach.ts
docs.text: An async TypeScript library for the scratch API (missing features)
